meanings.sent1: The beach was covered in rokes, creating a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: Rokes (verb): To move swiftly or energetically.
meanings.sent1: She rokes through the forest, eager to reach her destination.
meanings.sent2: The cheetah rokes across the savanna in pursuit of its prey.
meanings.sent3: The children roked around the playground, full of energy and laughter.
meanings.sent4: The wind rokes through the trees, creating a soothing melody.
meanings.sent5: The athlete rokes towards the finish line, determined to win the race.

meanings.definition: Rokes (adjective): Having a rough or rugged appearance.
meanings.sent1: The old castle had a rokes exterior, showing its long history.
meanings.sent2: The mountain range had a rokes terrain, making it a challenging climb.
meanings.sent3: The weathered ship had a rokes charm, evoking tales of the sea.
meanings.sent4: His rokes hands told the story of hard work and perseverance.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins had a rokes beauty, standing the test of time.
